verses.verse: Bildad Speaks: How Can a Mortal Be Righteous Before God? Then Bildad the Shuhite answered:
(Job 9.4; 22.12; Rev 1.6) “Dominion and fear are with God; (Heb him) he makes peace in his high heaven.
(Jas 1.17) Is there any number to his armies? Upon whom does his light not arise?
(Job 4.17; 14.4; Ps 143.2) How then can a mortal be righteous before God? How can one born of woman be pure?
(Job 15.15; 31.26) If even the moon is not bright and the stars are not pure in his sight,
(Job 7.17; Ps 22.6) how much less a mortal, who is a maggot, and a human being, who is a worm!”
